se.soprasteria.automatedtesting.webdriver.api.utility

Class ElementHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.soprasteria.automatedtesting.webdriver.api.utility.ElementHelper

  • public class ElementHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Helpers to streamline working with Selenium WebElements. All time units are milliseconds unless something else is specified. These helper functions provide the following functionality: - wrap wait functionality so that the explicit waits it works well with implicit waits - wraps waits into booleans - wraps findElements into booleans in isPresent... - centralized debuglogging

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • clickWithinTime

        public void clickWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement webElement,
                            int timeoutMillis,
                            java.lang.String errorMessage)
                     throws java.lang.AssertionError
        Wait for the element to be clickable and then click it. If the element isn't clickable within the specified time an assertionerror is thrown.
        Parameters:
        webElement - element to click
        timeoutMillis - timeout before throwing the assertionerrors. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        errorMessage - message to show if the element isn't clicked in time
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError

      • clickWithinTime

        public boolean clickWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement webElement,
                               int timeoutMillis)
        Wait for the element to be clickable and then click it. If the element isn't clickable within the specified time no assertionerror is thrown, execution just continues
        Parameters:
        webElement - WebElement to click
        timeoutMillis - timeout before throwing the assertionerrors. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        Returns:
        boolean specifying if a click occured

      • isElementPresentAndDisplayed

        public boolean isElementPresentAndDisplayed(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement webElement)
        Check if element is displayed IF you don't know if the element is currently displayed OR if you expect the element not to be present. If you are sure the element is currently displayed use webElement.isDisplayed() instead.
        Parameters:
        webElement - WebElement to inspect
        Returns:
        true if the element was present and displayed, false if it wasn't.

      • isElementPresentAndDisplayedWithinTime

        public boolean isElementPresentAndDisplayedWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement webElement,
                                                      int timeoutMillis)
        Check if the element is present in the DOM and displayed, use IF you don't know if the element is currently displayed AND if you expect the element not to be present. If you are sure the element is currently present in the DOM use isElementDisplayedWithinTime(webElement, timeoutMillis) instead.
        Parameters:
        webElement - WebElement to inspect
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        Returns:
        true if the element was present and displayed before timeoutMillis ran out, false if it wasn't.

      • waitForElementToBePresentAndDisplayed

        public void waitForElementToBePresentAndDisplayed(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement webElement,
                                                  int timeoutMillis)
        Wait for element to be present in the DOM and displayed, use IF you don't know if the element is currently displayed AND if you expect the element not to be present. If you are sure the element is currently present in the DOM use waitForElementToBeDisplayed(webElement, timeoutMillis) instead.
        Parameters:
        webElement - WebElement to inspect
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.

      • isElementClickableWithinTime

        public boolean isElementClickableWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                            int timeoutMillis)
        Check if the element is clickable within the time frame. Clickable means the element is enabled, visible on screen and that it's not covered by any other elements.
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement to inspect
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        Returns:
        true if the element was clickable before timeoutMillis ran out, false if it wasn't.

      • isElementDisplayedWithinTime

        public boolean isElementDisplayedWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                            int timeoutMillis)
        Check if the element is displayed within the time frame. Displayed means the element is visible on screen, it does not have to be enabled.
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement to inspect
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        Returns:
        true if the element was displayed before the timeoutMillis ran out, false if it wasn't.

      • isElementDisplayedWithinTime

        public boolean isElementDisplayedWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.By by,
                                            int timeoutMillis)
        Check if the element is displayed within the time frame. Displayed means the element is visible on screen, it does not have to be enabled.
        Parameters:
        by - By to search for and inspect
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        Returns:
        true if the element was displayed before the timeoutMillis ran out, false if it wasnt.

      • isElementGoneWithinTime

        public boolean isElementGoneWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                       int timeoutMillis)
        Check for an element to no longer be displayed within the time frame. It will continually poll until timeout is exceeded for as long as element is displayed. Will return true if element is no longer displayed (or wasn't to begin with).
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement to search for
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        Returns:
        true if the element was no longer present in the DOM before the timeoutMillis ran out, false if it still was.

      • isElementHiddenWithinTime

        @Beta
public boolean isElementHiddenWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                               int timeoutMillis)
        Check if the element is hidden within the specified time. Hidden means the element is not visible on screen but present in the DOM.
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement to search for
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        Returns:
        true if element is invisible (ie with the 'hidden' tag)

        Parameters:

      • isElementPresentWithinTime

        public boolean isElementPresentWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.By by,
                                          int timeoutMillis)
        Check is element is present in the DOM within the time frame. The element can be present in the DOM without being visible or displayed on the page.
        Parameters:

                                        java.lang.String searchString,

        Use element sendkeys with a controlled pause between each keypress. Usable for instance when entering keypresses in dynamic searches (where you get suggestions as you enter more keypresses)

        public boolean isElementClickableAndRefreshedWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                                        int timeoutMillis)
        Check in an element is clickable and refreshed within the time frame. Use this method to prevent finding stale elements which would trigger a StaleElementReferenceException.
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement to inspect
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        Returns:
        true if the element was clickable before timeoutMillis ran out, false if it was not clickable

      • didElementChangeDuringInterval

        public boolean didElementChangeDuringInterval(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                              int timeoutMillis)
        Do an image comparison of the element before and after the given interval. Returns false if identical. When comparing elements visually the browser zoom level and windows/mac screen scaling must be at 100%
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement to compare
        timeoutMillis - time interval to wait for element comparison
        Returns:
        true if the element changed before timeoutMillis ran out, false if it did not change

      • didElementChangeDuringInterval

        public boolean didElementChangeDuringInterval(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                              float similarityPercentageThreshold,
                                              int timeoutMillis)
        Do an image comparison of the element before and after the given interval. Returns false if the given similarity threshold has been exceeded. When comparing elements visually the browser zoom level and windows/mac screen scaling must be at 100%
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement to compare
        similarityPercentageThreshold - threshold in percentage
        timeoutMillis - time interval to wait for element comparison
        Returns:
        true if the element changed before timeoutMillis ran out, false if it did not change

      • waitForAttributeValueToBePresent

        public void waitForAttributeValueToBePresent(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                             java.lang.String attribute,
                                             java.lang.String value,
                                             int timeoutMillis)
        Wait for the value to be present in the given elements attribute within the time frame.
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement containing attribute
        attribute - css or html attribute
        value - expected value of attribute
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.

        public boolean isAttributeValuePresentWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,

                                                 java.lang.String value,
                                                 int timeoutMillis)
        Check if the value is present in the given elements attribute within the time frame.
        Parameters:

        attribute - css or html attribute
        value - expected value of attribute
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        Returns:
        true if the value was present in the attribute within time, otherwise false

      • waitForAttributeValueToContain

        public void waitForAttributeValueToContain(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                           java.lang.String attribute,
                                           java.lang.String value,
                                           int timeoutMillis)
        Wait for the elements attribute value to contain the given value within the time frame.
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement containing attribute
        attribute - css or html attribute
        value - value the attributes value should contain
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.

      • doesAttributeValueContainWithinTime

        public boolean doesAttributeValueContainWithinTime(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                                   java.lang.String attribute,
                                                   java.lang.String value,
                                                   int timeoutMillis)
        Check if the elements attribute value contains the given value within the time frame.
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement containing attribute
        attribute - css or html attribute
        value - value the attributes value should contain
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        Returns:
        true if the attributes value contained given value within time, otherwise false

      • waitForElementsToBeDisplayed

        public void waitForElementsToBeDisplayed(java.util.List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> elements,
                                         int timeoutMillis)
        Wait for elements to be displayed within the time frame. Displayed means the element is visible on screen, it does not have to be enabled.
        Parameters:
        elements - List of elements to inspect
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.

      • isElementsDisplayedWithinTime

        public boolean isElementsDisplayedWithinTime(java.util.List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> elements,
                                             int timeoutMillis)
        Check if the elements is displayed within the time frame. Displayed means the element is visible on screen, it does not have to be enabled.
        Parameters:
        elements - List of elements to inspect
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.
        Returns:
        true if the elements was displayed before the timeoutMillis ran out, false if they weren't.

        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.

      • waitForNestedElementToBeDisplayed

        public void waitForNestedElementToBeDisplayed(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                              org.openqa.selenium.By childLocator,
                                              int timeoutMillis)
        Wait the located child of the parent element to be displayed within the time frame. If more than one nested element is found using the given locator the element found first is chosen. Displayed means that the element is visible on screen, it does not have to be enabled.
        Parameters:
        element - Parent element
        childLocator - By to search for children and inspect
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.

      • waitForNestedElementsToBeDisplayed

                                               org.openqa.selenium.By childLocator,
                                               int timeoutMillis)

        Parameters:
        element - Parent element
        childLocator - By to search for children and inspect
        timeoutMillis - time to wait in milliseconds, throws a TimeoutException if time runs out. Set to -1 to use current implicit timeoutMillis value.

        Returns:
